overview: Manali is a hill‑station in the Kullu Valley of Himachal Pradesh (population ~11,000). Situated at 2,050 m on the Beas River, it is a gateway to treks (Beas Kund, Chandrakhani Pass), adventure sports, and the road to Ladakh via Rohtang Pass. It attracts Indian tourists in summer for pleasant weather and in winter for snow‑covered scenery.
bestTimeToVisit: April to June (pleasant summer) and September to October (post‑monsoon, clear skies).
idealDuration: 3–4 days to cover the main sights and a short trek.
approximateDailyBudgetINR: ₹2,500 – ₹3,000 (including budget accommodation, meals, local transport and entry fees).
travelTips: Take a Volvo bus from Delhi (≈14 h) for the best value; private taxis cost ₹3,000‑₹4,000 per day.
Hire a motorbike (₹800‑₹1,500 per day) for flexibility; Royal Enfield models are common.
In winter (Oct‑Mar) pack warm clothing (down jackets, gloves, caps) as temperatures drop to –15 °C.
Book Rohtang Pass permits in advance; dress costs around ₹150‑₹200 per set.
Use local buses for cheap travel (₹10‑₹20) but expect irregular schedules; auto‑rickshaws charge about ₹200 to Solang Valley.
Eat at local dhabas and street stalls to keep food costs low; a meal typically costs ₹100‑₹200.
Travel off‑peak (late Oct‑early Dec or late Feb‑early Mar) for lower accommodation rates.
